title: Understanding Rotation of Axes
text: Rotating the coordinate axes involves transforming the equation of the conic to eliminate the xy-term. This allows for simplifying the equation to one that's easier to interpret.

title: Angle of Rotation Formula
text:
To rotate axes by an angle theta, you use trigonometric transformations:
New coordinates (x',y') from (x,y) are given by:
$$x$$ $$=$$ x'cos(theta) - y'sin(theta), and
$$y$$ $$=$$ x'sin(theta) + y'cos(theta).

title: Calculate Transformation for xy-Term Elimination
text: Substitute $$x$$ $$=$$ x'cos(45°) - y'sin(45°) and $$y$$ $$=$$ x'sin(45°) + y'cos(45°) in the original equation, and simplify.

title: Simplifying the Transformed Equation
text: Once substituted, combine like terms and simplify expressions involving trig values (since cos(45°) $$=$$ sin(45°) $$=$$ sqrt(2)/2) to reach the new equation.
